title: 1910-H
statement: H. Sum of Digits of Sumstime limit per test6 secondsmemory limit per test512 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputYou are given an array $$$[a_1, a_2, \\dots, a_n]$$$, consisting of positive integers.For every $$$i$$$ from $$$1$$$ to $$$n$$$, calculate $$$\\sum \\limits_{j=1}^{n} F(a_i + a_j)$$$, where $$$F(x)$$$ is the sum of digits of $$$x$$$.InputThe first line contains one integer $$$n$$$ ($$$2 \\le n \\le 2 \\cdot 10^5$$$).The second line contains $$$n$$$ integers $$$a_1, a_2, \\dots, a_n$$$ ($$$1 \\le a_i < 10^9$$$).OutputPrint $$$n$$$ integers. The $$$i$$$-th of them should be equal to $$$\\sum \\limits_{j=1}^{n} F(a_i + a_j)$$$.ExamplesInput4 1 3 3 7Output18 17 17 15Input3 42 1337 999Output38 53 47

processed.result:
You are given an array of positive integers. For each number in the array, calculate the sum of the digits of all possible sums you can get by adding it to every other number in the array.

**Input:**

* The first line contains an integer  *n* (2 ≤ *n* ≤ 2 * 10^5), representing the number of elements in the array.
* The second line contains *n* integers *a<sub>1</sub>, a<sub>2</sub>, ..., a<sub>n</sub>* (1 ≤ *a<sub>i</sub>* < 10^9), representing the elements of the array.

**Output:**

Print *n* integers. The *i*-th integer should be the sum of the digits of all possible sums you can get by adding *a<sub>i</sub>* to every other number in the array.
You are given a list of numbers. For each number in the list, calculate the sum of the digits of all possible sums you get by adding it to every other number in the list.
